pull.title: doc: update headers and TOC in `developer-notes.md`
pull.body:
The table of content wasn't adjusted when the corresponding entries were removed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32572, see:
* `Ignoring IDE/editor files`: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/faf65f05312be7647f485f088ba00fef97f47bf4
* `Shebang`: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/7777fb8bc749e18c178ef460b65219187e676128
* `Wallet`: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/fa69c5b170f56d554fcb0d0887bd27f961fe3e74

After the removals the missing ones were also added in a separate commit.
The headers were also unified from different underline styles to `#` format.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/33040.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [maflcko](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33040#issuecomment-3106851769), [yuvicc](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33040#issuecomment-3107360337), [janb84](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33040#pullrequestreview-3046968519) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#30361](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30361) (doc: Drop description of LogError messages as fatal by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->

I think we can also add 

```
- [Interface Naming Style]([Internal interface
    naming style](#internal-interface-naming-style))
```

rename.from: doc: remove dangling toc entries from `developer-notes.md`

events.body:
For reference, GitHub already generates those: https://github.blog/changelog/2021-04-13-table-of-contents-support-in-markdown-files/

So I guess this is for local usage? Seems fine, but instead of manually updating and reviewing it, it would be better to do with a script. There are many tools (https://github.com/search?q=markdown%20toc&type=repositories) or standalone scripts, such as https://github.com/openai/codex/blob/d6c4083f98094dbd8d86f70992729924d93f73c4/scripts/readme_toc.py#L1.
We can also just delete the whole TOC - but keeping it half-updated seems counter-productive to me
Seems fine to squash and call it "doc: regenerate toc"?

events.message:
doc: regenerate developer-notes TOC

The table of content wasn't adjusted when the corresponding entries were removed in #32572, see:
* `Ignoring IDE/editor files`: faf65f0
* `Shebang`: 7777fb8
* `Wallet`: fa69c5b

The missing headers were also added to the TOC, preserving their hierarchical structure.

rename.to: doc: update headers and TOC in `developer-notes.md`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1322,7 +1328,7 @@ Release notes should be added to a PR-specific release note file at
 All `release-notes*` files are merged into a single `release-notes-<version>.md` file prior to the release.
 
 RPC interface guidelines
---------------------------
+------------------------
comments.body: Updating those also seems busy-work and inconsistent with the other headings (`#`). My preference would be to just use `#` consistently and not switch between `=`, `-`, and `#` in the same file.
